reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Once again, a book I can’t put down. So interesting right from the start. You can feel the love that Penelope has for her sister and her determination to make a bad situation better. What she doesn’t expect is for her life to go the way it did. Willing to sacrifice for her sister she abides to the Dukes offer and from there everything goes out of her control. Great book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was a great story. Well written romance with a keep you guessing mystery. Happily ever after ending. Loved it. Highly recommend!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Revenge doesn't satisfy
reviews.reviewText: When her father is put in prison, Penelope is doomed to a life of scandal and despair. The duke who got his revenge on her family isn't satisfied and so the wild dance of enemies to lovers begin. An interesting and well written story filled with trauma, deep emotions and drama. A good story for a relaxing afternoon with a cup of tea.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this book a different look on aristocratic people and finally getting what they deserve.Recommend this author and this new and old series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My Cruel Duke
reviews.reviewText: This was a fantastic story. It was well written and entertaining to read. I enjoyed the story line. The ending was perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars love the twists
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoy romance and a who-done-it. This had all the twists and romantic tension betwixt the characters to make a wonderful page turning read. I thoroughly enjoyed this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Worth the read
reviews.reviewText: The story of Rhys and Penny and how they both turned vengeance into love … I really liked the character of Rhys all dark, charming with a bit of vengeance … Penny I wasn’t so crazy about, while she had strongCharacter development… she came across all too often as whiny and pushy and very naive which just got exhausting at times ..The story line was great, I very much enjoyed the how’s and why’s of their story .. there was also a bonus story between Phillip who I like very much and Lydia (Pens younger sister)… their side story was also enjoyable ..All in all it was a good read tho Penny could have been less in some areas and better in others …

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Change of Heart
reviews.reviewText: A very enjoyable story of how the cruel duke found unexpected love in the marriage of convenience he contracted. Sunshine replaced darkness.
A simplistic yet captivating regency tale. With a tangled web of storylines, it keeps you guessing until the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book has lots of twists and turns. There is selfishness, attempted murder, actual murder and betrayal. It is steamy in parts but not a lot. Duke Rhysand and Penny marry for convenience. They agree to stay together until Penny is with child. Their relationship is overshadowed by the actions of Penny's father. Will Penny be able to help Rhysand to put aside his bad humour and smile again? Will they discover the murderer in their midst? Will they eventually find happiness? Read on and enjoy this well-written story.

Rhysand and Penelope start their relationship for all the wrong reasons (except wanting to help her sister out): bitterness and revenge never were elements that lead to a positive outcome. But destiny and time find extraordinary way to turn wrongs into something right.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Love Story With Unexpected Twists
reviews.reviewText: A nice book with a good plot, very likeable characters, battles of wills and words, some steamy love scenes, unexpected twists and a touch of suspense, but in my opinion also with some lengths.After her father's imprisonment and her brother's escape to the continent, Penny and her sister are shunned by society and left destitute.Rhysand is called the Cruel Duke and lives in obscurity - literally. Traumatised by the murder of his family and consumed by hatred and rage, he prefers a secluded life.Now he has finally got the revenge he has been waiting years for.When Penny comes to him for help, he offers her a marriage of convenience. A debut for her sister in exchange for an heir and she agrees.They are both attracted to each other right from the start, but Rhysand doesn't want to change his life for her, until Penny provokes him and slowly draws him out of his shell...If you enjoy historical romances with brooding heroes, defiant heroines, some spice and a touch of suspense, you will like this book.
